meanings.sent1: During the barbecue, John outsmoked everyone with his perfectly grilled ribs.
meanings.sent2: She outsmoked her friends in the smoking contest by finishing her cigarette first.
meanings.sent3: The little chimney outsmoked the big one by puffing out more smoke.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outsmoke his opponent was evident in every puff he took.
meanings.sent5: The old smoker's trick helped him outsmoke the young competitors effortlessly.

meanings.definition: To defeat in a smoking competition.
meanings.sent1: In the smoking challenge, Sarah outsmoked all her rivals with her steady pace.
meanings.sent2: He outsmoked his opponent by taking longer drags and blowing bigger smoke rings.
meanings.sent3: The cat outsmoked the dog in the smoking race, leaving it coughing in the dust.
meanings.sent4: The champion outsmoked every contender, proving his skills in the smoking arena.
meanings.sent5: The determined smoker outsmoked the odds and emerged victorious in the competition.
